Just ordered a copy. Thanks for the heads-up Andres. Yes, I have considered=
 that book whenever it came to mind but being a procrastinator...so now it'=
s done! (Old guys need a push sometimes!)

Back in the '80s Roland Knutsen =
wrote an article on polearms for the JSS/US Newsletter. I'll have to dig th=
at out and have look at it again; if so, I'll pass on the issue number for =
those interested (who have back issues). I could never forget the article b=
ecause he submitted in in longhand and being unfamiliar with many of the te=
rms he used, it was a bear to type up (before computers) for that issue. Dr=
ove me nuts, but I was thrilled to have the material. Again, I'll try to fi=
nd out when this was done and will pass that info on.

Ron
STL



  ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
  From: Andres Pedraza 
  To: nihonto@...=
m ; nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, December 07, 2006 6:43 =
PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Yari and Naginata


  Nihonto People,

  I hav=
en't seen a whole lot of books on Yari and/or Naginata in 
  English, so ev=
en though it was a bit pricy, I purchased Roald and 
  Susan Knutsen's book=
 (http://tinyurl.com/yxlhuj). I just finished it. 
  I am very impressed an=
d sorry I did not purchase it earlier. The 
  concise yet informative text =
plus the wealth of drawings and plates 
  was well worth the price.

  If t=
here's anyone else out there interested in the subject and that 
  has been=
 on the fence about this great book because of the price tag, 
  well, stop=
 considering it and buy it. Give it to yourself for 
  Christmas. You won't=
 regret it.

  And if Roald and Susan subscribe to these lists (or someone =
who knows 
  them does) please receive a big thank you from me... This book=
 will 
  be a permanent part of my reference library.

  Anyone have any ot=
her books on Yari and/or Naginata they want to 
  recommend? I'm thirsty fo=
r more knowledge now.

  Thanks!

  Andres
